To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

children.name: borderJoin
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`borderMiterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

children.name: borderMiterLimit
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`borderJoin`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```ts
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: select
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`



Select state of single data.

children.name: disabled
children.desc:
> Since `v5.3.0`



If data can be selected. Available when `selectedMode` is used. Can be used to disable selection for part of the data.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```ts
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element.


It is valid only when `position` is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

children.name: formatter
color
children.desc:
text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: fontStyle
children.desc:
font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`

children.name: fontWeight
children.desc:
font thick weight.

+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...

If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

children.name: borderType
children.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With

children.name: borderRadius
children.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

children.name: padding
children.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc: Show blur of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

Example: ```ts // absolute position, which is 10px to the left side and 10px to the top side of the container position: [10, 10] // relative position, in the exact center of the container position: ['50%', '50%'] ``` + `Function` Callback function in the following form: ```ts (point: Array, params: Object|Array.


```ts
// Add $ prefix
valueFormatter: (value) => '$' + value.toFixed(2)
```

The floating layer of tooltip space around content. The unit is px. Default values for each position are 5. And they can be set to different values with left, right, top, and bottom. Examples: ```ts // Set padding to be 5 padding: 5 // Set the top and bottom paddings to be 5, and left and right paddings to be 10 padding: [5, 10] // Set each of the four paddings seperately padding: [ 5, // up 10, // right 5, // down 10, // left ] ```

`textBorderDashOffset`

```ts
{

textBorderType: [5, 10],

textBorderDashOffset: 5
}
```

+ `'break'` Break by word

Extra CSS style for floating layer. The following is an example for adding shadow. ```ts extraCssText: 'box-shadow: 0 0 3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);' ```

name: markPoint
desc: Mark point in a chart.

children.name: symbol
children.desc:
Symbol of .



Icon types provided by ECharts includes



`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`







It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://example.website/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```



Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```












If symbols needs to be different, you can set with callback function in the following format:
```ts
(value: Array|number, params: Object) => string
```
The first parameter `value` is the value in [data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.data), and the second parameter `params` is the rest parameters of data item.

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc:
symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.


If size of symbols needs to be different, you can set with callback function in the following format:
```ts
(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array
```
The first parameter `value` is the value in [data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.data), and the second parameter `params` is the rest parameters of data item.

children.name: symbolRotate
children.desc:
Rotate degree of  symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.


If rotation of symbols needs to be different, you can set with callback function in the following format:
```ts
(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number
```
The first parameter `value` is the value in [data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.data), and the second parameter `params` is the rest parameters of data item.
> Callback is supported since 4.8.0 .

children.name: symbolKeepAspect
children.desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

children.name: symbolOffset
children.desc:
Offset of  symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '-50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

children.name: silent
children.desc: Whether to ignore mouse events. Default value is false, for triggering and responding to mouse events.

children.name: label
children.desc: Label of mark point.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```ts
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element.


It is valid only when `position` is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

color

text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`

children.name: fontWeight

Options are:

+ `'lighter'`

children.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With

children.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

children.name: padding
children.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc: Show blur of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc:
border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc:
border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts

borderType: [5, 10],

```

children.name: borderDashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: borderCap
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

children.name: borderJoin
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`borderMiterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

children.name: borderMiterLimit
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`borderJoin`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```ts
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: textBorderColor
children.desc:
Stroke color of the text.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: textBorderWidth
children.desc: Stroke line width of the text.

children.name: textBorderType
children.desc:
Stroke line type of the text.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`textBorderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

textBorderType: [5, 10],

textBorderDashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: textBorderDashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`textBorderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.

children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.desc: Width of text block.

children.name: height
children.desc: Height of text block.

children.name: overflow
children.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow. Available when `width` is set.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the text and trailing with `ellipsis`.
+ `'break'` Break by word
+ `'breakAll'` Break by character.

children.name: ellipsis
children.desc:
Ellipsis to be displayed when `overflow` is set to `truncate`.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the overflow lines.

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc:
border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc:
border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: borderDashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: borderCap
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

children.name: borderJoin
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`borderMiterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

children.name: borderMiterLimit
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`borderJoin`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```ts
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: blur
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`



Configurations of blur state. Whether to blur follows the series.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```ts
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element.


It is valid only when `position` is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`borderJoin`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```ts
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: data
name
children.desc: Mark point name.

children.name: type
children.desc:
Special label types, are used to label maximum value, minimum value and so on.

**Options are:**
+ `'min'` maximum value.
+ `'max'` minimum value.
+ `'average'` average value.

children.name: valueIndex
children.desc: Available when using [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.markPoint.data.type) it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be `0` (xAxis, radiusAxis), `1` (yAxis, angleAxis), and use the first value axis dimension by default.

children.name: valueDim
children.desc: Works only when [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.markPoint.data.type) is assigned. It is used to state the dimension used to calculate maximum value or minimum value. It may be the direct name of a dimension, like `x`, or `angle` for line charts, or `open`, or `close` for candlestick charts.

children.name: coord
x
children.desc: X position according to container, in pixel.

children.name: y
children.desc: Y position according to container, in pixel.

children.name: value
children.desc: Label value, which can be ignored.

children.name: symbol
children.desc:
Symbol of .



Icon types provided by ECharts includes



`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`







It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://example.website/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```



Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc: symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.

children.name: symbolRotate
children.desc: Rotate degree of  symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.

children.name: symbolKeepAspect
children.desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

children.name: symbolOffset
children.desc:
Offset of  symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '-50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc: Mark point style.

children.name: color
children.desc:
color.



> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#color) for details

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc:
border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc:
border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: borderDashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: borderCap
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

children.name: borderJoin
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`borderMiterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

children.name: borderMiterLimit
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`borderJoin`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```ts
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```ts
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element.


It is valid only when `position` is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

children.name: color
children.desc:
text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: fontStyle
children.desc:
font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`

children.name: fontWeight
children.desc:
font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...

children.name: fontFamily
children.desc:
font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

children.name: fontSize
children.desc: font size.

children.name: align
verticalAlign
lineHeight
backgroundColor
borderColor
children.desc:
Border color of the text fragment.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

children.name: borderType
children.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With

children.name: borderRadius
children.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

children.name: padding
children.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc: Show blur of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the text and trailing with `ellipsis`.

+ `'breakAll'` Break by character.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the overflow lines.

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`textBorderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

textBorderType: [5, 10],

textBorderDashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: padding

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

children.name: shadowColor

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc: Show blur of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc:
border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

borderType: [5, 10],

}
```

children.name: borderDashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: borderCap
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

children.name: borderJoin
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`borderMiterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

children.name: borderMiterLimit
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`borderJoin`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```ts
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```ts
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element.


It is valid only when `position` is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: animation
children.desc: Whether to enable animation.

children.name: animationThreshold
children.desc: Whether to set graphic number threshold to animation. Animation will be disabled when graphic number is larger than threshold.

children.name: animationDuration
animationEasing
children.desc: Easing method used for the first animation. Varied easing effects can be found at [easing effect example](line-easing).

children.name: animationDelay
animationDurationUpdate
animationEasingUpdate
children.desc: Easing method used for animation.

children.name: animationDelayUpdate

name: markLine
desc: Use a line in the chart to illustrate.

children.name: silent
children.desc: Whether to ignore mouse events. Default value is false, for triggering and responding to mouse events.

children.name: symbol
children.desc: Symbol type at the two ends of the mark line. It can be an array for two ends, or assigned seperately. See [data.symbol](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.markLine.data.0.symbol) for more format information.

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc:
Symbol size at the two ends of the mark line. It can be an array for two ends, or assigned seperately.

**Attention: ** You cannot assgin width and height seperately as normal `symbolSize`.

children.name: precision
children.desc: Precision of marking line value, which is useful when displaying average value mark line.

children.name: label
children.desc: Mark line text.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether show label or not.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Positions of labels can be:
+ `'start'` starting point of the line.
+ `'middle'` middle point of the line.
+ `'end'` ending point of the line.

Since v4.7.0, more label positions are supported: `'start'`, `'middle'`, `'end'`, `'insideStartTop'`, `'insideStartBottom'`, `'insideMiddleTop'`, `'insideMiddleBottom'`, `'insideEndTop'`, `'insideEndBottom'`.

`'insideMiddleBottom'` is the same as `'middle'`. Position is as the following chart.

The distance between labels and mark lines can be set with [label.distance](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-.markLine.label.distance).

~[800x500](line-markline&reset=1&edit=1)

children.name: distance
children.desc: The distance between labels and mark lines. If it's an array, then the first element is the horizontal distance, and the second element is the vertical distance. If it's a number, then the horizontal and vertical distances are the same.

children.name: formatter
color
children.desc:
text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: fontStyle
children.desc:
font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`

children.name: fontWeight
children.desc:
font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...

children.name: fontFamily
children.desc:
font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

children.name: fontSize
children.desc: font size.

children.name: lineHeight
backgroundColor
borderColor
children.desc:
Border color of the text fragment.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

children.name: borderType
children.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: borderDashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: borderRadius
children.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

children.name: padding
children.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc: Show blur of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

`textBorderDashOffset`

For example：

```ts
{

textBorderDashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: color
children.desc:
Line color.





> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#color) for details

children.name: width
children.desc: line width.

children.name: type
children.desc:
line type.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`dashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

type: [5, 10],

dashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: dashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`type`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: cap
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

children.name: join
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`miterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

children.name: miterLimit
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`join`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```ts
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: curveness
children.desc: Edge curvature, which supports value from 0 to 1. The larger the value, the greater the curvature.

children.name: emphasis
children.desc: Emphasis status of mark line.

children.name: disabled
children.desc:
> Since `v5.3.0`



Whether to disable the emphasis state.

When emphasis state is disabled. There will be no highlight effect when the mouse hovered the element, tooltip is triggered, or the legend is hovered. It can be used to improve interaction fluency when there are massive graphic elements.

Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: textBorderColor
children.desc:
Stroke color of the text.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: textBorderWidth
children.desc: Stroke line width of the text.

children.name: textBorderType
children.desc:
Stroke line type of the text.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`textBorderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

textBorderType: [5, 10],

textBorderDashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: textBorderDashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`textBorderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: textShadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.

children.name: textShadowBlur
children.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

children.name: textShadowOffsetX
children.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.

children.name: textShadowOffsetY
children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: color
children.desc:
Line color.





> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#color) for details

children.name: width
children.desc: line width.

children.name: type
children.desc:
line type.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`dashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

type: [5, 10],

dashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: dashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`type`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: cap
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

children.name: join
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`miterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

children.name: miterLimit
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`join`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```ts
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: blur
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`



Configurations of blur state. Whether to blur follows the series.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether show label or not.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Positions of labels can be:
+ `'start'` starting point of the line.
+ `'middle'` middle point of the line.
+ `'end'` ending point of the line.

Since v4.7.0, more label positions are supported: `'start'`, `'middle'`, `'end'`, `'insideStartTop'`, `'insideStartBottom'`, `'insideMiddleTop'`, `'insideMiddleBottom'`, `'insideEndTop'`, `'insideEndBottom'`.

`'insideMiddleBottom'` is the same as `'middle'`. Position is as the following chart.

The distance between labels and mark lines can be set with [label.distance](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-.markLine.label.distance).

~[800x500](line-markline&reset=1&edit=1)

children.name: distance
children.desc: The distance between labels and mark lines. If it's an array, then the first element is the horizontal distance, and the second element is the vertical distance. If it's a number, then the horizontal and vertical distances are the same.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: data

children.desc: Data of the starting point.

children.name: type
children.desc:
Special label types, are used to label maximum value, minimum value and so on.

**Options are:**
+ `'min'` minimum value.
+ `'max'` maximum value.
+ `'average'` average value.
+ `'median'` median value.

children.name: valueIndex
children.desc: Works only when [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.markLine.data.type) is assigned. It is used to state the dimension used to calculate maximum value or minimum value. It may be `0` (for xAxis, or radiusAxis), or `1` (for yAxis, or angleAxis). Dimension of the first numeric axis is used by default.

children.name: valueDim
children.desc: Works only when [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.markLine.data.type) is assigned. It is used to state the dimension used to calculate maximum value or minimum value. It may be the direct name of a dimension, like `x`, or `angle` for line charts, or `open`, or `close` for candlestick charts.

children.name: coord
name
children.desc: Name of the marker, which will display as a label.

children.name: x
children.desc: X position according to container, in pixel.

children.name: y
children.desc: Y position according to container, in pixel.

children.name: xAxis
children.desc:
Markline at x at given value, which only works for single data item. Example:

```
data: [{
name: 'A vertical line with X valued 100',
xAxis: 100
}]
```

or if xAxis is in `'time'` type, it can be set as:

```
{
name: 'A vertical line with X valued "2020-01-01"',
xAxis: '2020-01-01'
}]
```

children.name: yAxis
children.desc:
Markline at y at given value, which only works for single data item. Example:

```
data: [{
name: 'A horizontal line with X valued 100',
yAxis: 100
}]
```

or if yAxis is in `'time'` type, it can be set as:

```
{
name: 'A horizontal line with Y valued "2020-01-01"',
yAxis: '2020-01-01'
}]
```

children.name: value
children.desc: Label value, which can be ignored.

children.name: symbol
children.desc:
Symbol of 0.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes



`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`







It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://example.website/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```



Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc: 0 symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.

children.name: symbolRotate
children.desc: Rotate degree of 0 symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.

children.name: symbolKeepAspect
children.desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

children.name: symbolOffset
children.desc:
Offset of 0 symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '-50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

children.name: lineStyle
children.desc: Line style of this data item, which will be merged with `lineStyle` of starting point and ending point.

children.name: color
children.desc:
Line color.





> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#color) for details

children.name: width
children.desc: line width.

children.name: type
children.desc:
line type.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`dashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```ts
{

type: [5, 10],

dashOffset: 5
}
```

children.name: dashOffset
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`type`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

children.name: cap
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

children.name: join
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`miterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

children.name: miterLimit
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`join`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```ts
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: curveness
children.desc: Edge curvature, which supports value from 0 to 1. The larger the value, the greater the curvature.

children.name: label
children.desc: Label of this data item, which will be merged with `label` of starting point and ending point.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether show label or not.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Positions of labels can be:
+ `'start'` starting point of the line.
+ `'middle'` middle point of the line.
+ `'end'` ending point of the line.

Since v4.7.0, more label positions are supported: `'start'`, `'middle'`, `'end'`, `'insideStartTop'`, `'insideStartBottom'`, `'insideMiddleTop'`, `'insideMiddleBottom'`, `'insideEndTop'`, `'insideEndBottom'`.

`'insideMiddleBottom'` is the same as `'middle'`. Position is as the following chart.

The distance between labels and mark lines can be set with [label.distance](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-.markLine.label.distance).

~[800x500](line-markline&reset=1&edit=1)

children.name: distance
children.desc: The distance between labels and mark lines. If it's an array, then the first element is the horizontal distance, and the second element is the vertical distance. If it's a number, then the horizontal and vertical distances are the same.

children.name: formatter
color
children.desc:
text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: fontStyle
children.desc:
font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`

children.name: fontWeight
children.desc:
font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...

children.name: fontFamily
children.desc:
font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

children.name: fontSize
children.desc: font size.

borderColor
children.desc:

If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

children.name: borderType
children.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With

`borderType`

children.name: borderRadius
children.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

children.name: padding
children.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc: Show blur of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: ellipsis

Ellipsis to be displayed when `overflow` is set to `truncate`.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the overflow lines.

children.name: cap
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

children.name: join
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`miterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

children.name: miterLimit
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`join`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```ts
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: curveness
children.desc: Edge curvature, which supports value from 0 to 1. The larger the value, the greater the curvature.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether show label or not.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Positions of labels can be:
+ `'start'` starting point of the line.
+ `'middle'` middle point of the line.
+ `'end'` ending point of the line.

Since v4.7.0, more label positions are supported: `'start'`, `'middle'`, `'end'`, `'insideStartTop'`, `'insideStartBottom'`, `'insideMiddleTop'`, `'insideMiddleBottom'`, `'insideEndTop'`, `'insideEndBottom'`.

`'insideMiddleBottom'` is the same as `'middle'`. Position is as the following chart.

The distance between labels and mark lines can be set with [label.distance](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-.markLine.label.distance).

~[800x500](line-markline&reset=1&edit=1)

children.name: distance
children.desc: The distance between labels and mark lines. If it's an array, then the first element is the horizontal distance, and the second element is the vertical distance. If it's a number, then the horizontal and vertical distances are the same.
